description: In early '90s Boston, FBI agent Jackie Rohr works within the corrupt culture. But Decourcy Ward, the new Assistant D.A., wants to uproot the system. After an armored car robbery, the two men find themselves in a possible alliance.
tags: ['car', 'sex scene', 'woman on top']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Cops are at a funeral, Jackie Rohr talks to an older peer about a Commission set up to investigate the Boston PD. Jackie says nice things to the widow about her late husband. In the parking lot Jackie continues joking with his buddy. The older cop finally tires and warns Jackie times have changed for cops, he leaves shaking his head. Jackie then pays some other men $20 ea for showing up, after promising $50.

Decourcey Ward buys a coffee with Detective Hank Signe. Uniformed cops barge past and make him spill his hot drink, Ward looks ready to start something, but then buys the cops their coffees, smiling.

A team of plainclothes cops enter an apartment with weapons, it's the wrong unit, but a resident pulls a gun and shoots, then escapes out the back. One cop is hit in the leg, they realize they went into 127 not 217 as on the warrant. A young man is kicked in the face.

Ward is given the case, his boss gave it to him as an easy slam dunk cop shooting for his first trial.

Frankie Ryan goes to a bar and plays a lottery ticket. The bartender locks the door, men bring out a crate of weapons, military M16s and an AK-47.

Rohr goes to the jail to see his snitch, the guy who was kicked in the face. The guy wants Jackie to get him released. Outside the jail a prosecutor tells Rohr the case was assigned to Ward, the new guy who was on the St.Clair Commission. Both laugh and roll their eyes.

Near the docks Frankie Ryan and his gang get into a van and change the plates. An armored car makes it rounds. The gang puts on hockey goalie masks and take over the bank vehicle.

Jackie goes to court to see Decourcey Ward, asking nicely to let the prisoner Roach go. Ward gets defensive and refuses.

In the armored car one of the guards makes an attempt to fight back, but is shot in the head. The driver, Frankie, almost loses control but manages to drive off the road to a quiet park. One of the gang was unmasked in the struggle. Frankie tries to calm things down. The two remaining guards plead for their lives and swear they won't talk, even suggesting they take some of the money to be considered accomplices. Frankie goes for a short walk to think it over, then returns and kills the two guards with point blank shots.

Jackie is having sex with a girlfriend, both take some cocaine. After he kisses her and leaves, the girl's mother complains as he leaves through the kitchen of the restaurant, happily waving to two other cops having an after hours meal. Jackie goes home, slipping in quietly. His daughter is puking into a toilet.

The gang seal up two 50 gal. barrels with the dead guards, they dump the barrels into the river and watch them sink.

Siobhan looks at what her husband Decourcey is doing, reading the file on the cop shooting. They kiss and joke around.

In the Rohr kitchen Jackie meets his wife Jenny and mother-in-law. Jenny asks about his night shift work and makes a sarcastic comment about his sniffles.

Jackie goes to Ward's boss to see about getting Roach off. They discuss Ward, his career ambitions and his wife, who has the money. The DA asks Ward to drop Roach, who still refuses on principle.

Ward goes to a homicide scene at night, #99 on the year. Ward asks Det. Signe about Jackie Rohr. The cop tells him Jackie is the "Doug Flutie" of the FBI and is well respected for a major Mafia bust 10 years ago. He suggests it wouldn't hurt to do Rohr a favor and not to get on his bad side.

Frankie Ryan goes home with groceries. He relaxes on a sofa, his daughter Kick calls to him, she has nightmares about him going missing, she dreams of "Uncle Kinicki", he tucks her back in to bed. His wife Cathy comes to get him. Frank has to go to get his younger brother from the local police station, Jimmy is drunk, and had caused some racist trouble; the friendly cop on duty let's them go out the back way.

In court Ward closes a case, Jackie brings him a coffee and tries to make amends. Ward wants the name of the real cop shooter, he sternly tells Rohr he wants to clean up corruption in the city. Jackie finds it amusing.

Ward goes to a precinct to see Detective Minogue, the leader of the apartment bust that went wrong. The cop is aggressive and expects the DA to back him up, trying to cover up they went to the wrong place and there were two men, not just Roach. The cop scoffs when he hears Rohr is asking for Roach, then hints infamous mobster Whitey Bulger is being protected by the FBI. Minogue dislikes Rohr.

Jackie sings along to Rush on his car audio, getting himself hyped up. He enters a Boston police station to see the cop who let Jimmy Hayes go. The two agree to a deal. Jackie goes to a stakeout location to see Det. Minogue. They argue in the van, Jackie mentions the cop's brother Gary hinting at some embarrassment, and tells Minogue to change his story at trial so Roach will be freed.

Jimmy Hayes drives to a market, his brother Frankie works in the produce department. Jimmy needs some cash, to take a rehab in Florida where his kids live. Jimmy gets angry and then tearful, leaving.

At the Roach trial Jackie watches from the back seats. Det. Minogue blindsides Ward with his testimony. In chambers the Judge tells Ward he is too righteous and should have let Roach go before trial. At home Decourcey is furious at how the system just turned on him, Siobhan wonders why he didn't just do what was asked, they squabble over his ethics.

Jimmy Hayes makes eye contact with a woman at a bar and soon they are banging in the washroom. Two men interrupt them and start a fight, Jimmy, a good scrapper, takes them both out and swallows a shot of spirits. In the morning he is still at the bar, greeted by Frankie. Frankie is upset with Jimmy wanting him to grow up and straighten out. Jimmy asks about Kick and her dreams about Kelly Kinicki.

At a hairdressers women talk about the armored car robbery. Kick Hayes comes in with a bloody face from a fight with another kid, her mother Cathy is frantic and takes the child aside. She cleans the girl up and then tells her to go and get even. Later, Kick sleeps while Uncle Jimmy plays with the other two Hayes' kids. In the bedroom Frankie tells Cathy they only got $1500 each from the heist. He asks her to give Jimmy some money, she checks her ledger and reluctantly seems to agree. They have sex.

Ward works late in the office. Two Investigators show him the armored car robbery file with the missing presumed dead guards. The detectives say give it to the Feds because no one in Charlestown will talk to Boston PD.

Frankie has a smoke outside his market, a uniform cop walks close by to see him scratching a lottery ticket.

Ward goes to a bar where Jackie Rohr is telling his war stories. Ward asks Rohr what he wants, which is to retire with a pension. Ward invites him to help with the armored car case with missing guards. Ward wants to clean up Charlestown.

Frankie and Jimmy wait on some steps, they meet his gang. Frankie wants to do another truck job, Jimmy and another man Tommy start to fight, Frankie breaks up the meeting.

Jackie explains an approach to Ward. They need to find a cold case so they can start a Grand Jury and subpoena bank robber suspects in Charlestown. Then they find someone to inform on the robbery to avoid jail for the cold case. Ward is impressed, Jackie happily says he was in Law School class of '68. Ward will get the credit.

At the Ebbtide bar the gang reassembles, Jimmy behaves.

Over more drinks Ward opens up to Rohr, and shows his glass eye from being beaten up by his father growing up in Memphis.

The hockey goalie gang take out a red Wells Fargo truck in New Hampshire.

Jackie has a smoke and waits, Jimmy Hayes approaches him to say he knows where the Revere Armoured Car bodies are buried.

description: After an eventful Sunday at church, Decourcy finds out he has a new powerful enemy in town; Jackie is stirring up trouble at home, and his distrustful mother-in-law Rosa is onto him.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Jackie Rohr meets his snitch at a waterfront park, two days after the latest bank car heist. Jimmy Ryan wants $20g to tell the location of the armored car, which should have the dead guard bodies. Jimmy also says the Ebbtide is where the robbers got their guns.

Frankie Ryan and Tommy Hayes bring duffle bags to the Hairdreser shop. His wife Cathy counts the money, $250g, too much for her to launder. They discuss laundering the cash at a casino, she says they can only do $10g that way, she wants to lay low. Frankie then says he sold the guns they used back to the bartender, so they can't be traced to them.

Jackie goes to the seedy Ebbtide bar. The bartender refuses to serve him. Jackie snorts a line of coke off the bar, warns the man and leaves.

At the DAs office new investigator Rachel introduces herself; attractive, she's tougher than she looks. She mentions another truck heist in New Hampshire. Jackie arrives and insults her, asks if they know about the Ebbtide. They look at an old missing persons file, Kelly Kinicki. The team meets a Boston PD detective to ask about the Kinicki case from 1988. The cop says his case lost at trial, blaming the prosecutor.

Frankie hides the cash in his washroom behind a medicine cabinet, checking the fit and finish. Jimmy comes and teases his sister-in-law Cathy. The daughter Kick seems somber. Jimmy and Frankie dress in suits and go to a casino. They have fun drinking and gambling $10g.

Jackie is having sex with his Asian gf, as he goes down on her he notices something on her crotch. He goes to a free clinic and is checked for STD.

Frankie takes his drunk brother home, they laugh that Jimmy will be blamed for losing the money.

Decourcey Ward is getting dressed, with his wife Siobahn, they had a romantic night and she talks about their political plans. She's a lawyer also. They kiss and are in love, they will be going to a church.

In Roxbury a preacher makes a eulogy for a dead young man. Ward and Siobahn arrive in church and take a pew. During a rousing call for community unity, a man enters staggering, two more follow him in and fire weapons, the congregation panics and flee, the gunmen escape. Ward just watches his wife and the preacher tend to the man who was shot. Cops arrive with guns pointed, Ward puts his hands up. Later, Ward questions a woman who may have known the victim. In another room he tries to calm his wife down, she is excited about the events, wanting to get involved. He says it's not his first time.

He goes outside, nervous in the alley, Jackie arrives. They go to a bar, Ward explains what happened , how he had to raise his arms to the cops and how he didn't get involved in the triage. He feels he doesn't belong to either group. Jackie tries to reassure him telling a Bobby Kennedy anecdote, his motivation for becoming a G-man. The two bond.

Rohr visits a bookie. Jackie claims he put down $5000 on the Redskins, Vito realizes the cop is just shaking him down and hands over the money, $20g.

At the Rohr house Granny argues with her teenage granddaughter. A call comes in, Granny answers, the clinic reports Jack is "disease free", no STD. When Jack comes home she argues with her son-in-law, she reveals he has cooties. Jack then threatens to break her late husband's Fokker Triplane Red Baron model, but doesn't and leaves the room.

Ward meets Signe coming to the office. They discuss a possible bad cop and need to find the bodies. In the office he watches Rachel work, she finds a file of interest. A low level thug, Tommy Hayes, had lied at the 1988 trial about when he went to the toilet. Jackie arrives and agrees to help, he calls his office to see if the FBI has info on Hayes. A short time later Jackie reports Hayes has his own home in Charlestown but no full time job. Ward and Rachel go to interview him about the 1988 case. Hayes gets nervous, saying he hadn't seen Kelly for four years. Outside, Rachel is impressed with Ward's interview skills.

Hayes goes to see Frankie at the market, he says he needs a lawyer. Frankie grimaces but says he'll get the lawyer.

Jackie is at home as his daughter is going out, she is dressed up and he warns her not to make a mistake. In the kitchen, Granny asks her daughter the last time she had sex, she hints Jackie hasn't been celibate, Jenny should put away some money for herself.

At a a church hall meeting, Ward is there and is called out by the preacher, Rev. Fields, the preacher charges Ward is a useless headline chaser, calling him a house nigger.

Jackie goes to his bedroom, his wife Jenny is dressed in sexy lingerie, she brings up how long it has been, she wants to have sex now, Jackie says he doesn't feel up to it. She storms out of the room crying. Jackie slumps to the floor sadly. Later he watches TV when Ward calls. Ward needs to show some success.

Jackie goes to see Ward's wife Siobhan. Over tea Jack says he will do what he can to help her husband's career, he recommends Ward leave the Roxbury church stuff alone, it won't help with white voters.

Frankie and Cathy have breakfast with Jimmy; she is angry he lost $10g gambling, they won't give him more. They mention Tommy Hayes has a lawyer regarding Kinicki, Jimmy realizes they gave money for that and he angrily storms to the washroom, rinsing his face and drinking from a mickey. He then notices the medicine cabinet and starts to pry at it but his pager beeps.

Jimmy meets Jack in a parking lot, Rohr hands over an envelope with $18g, laughing he took his tax, Jimmy gives the truck location. At a wharf a crane lifts the armored car from the harbor but drops it, the cops laugh.

description: Jackie searches for his absent informant as Jenny revisits her passion to become a teacher. Decourcy works up a plan to overcome the town's infamous "Code of Silence" and get a few suspects to talk. Jimmy skips town to visit his kids.
synopsis_with_character_names:
S1 E3

The armored car has no dead bodies inside. Jackie and Ward watch the water gush out the back. Jackie says infamous lawyer Roy Cohn was a genius. They continue to chat as the cops pour over the truck. Rachel makes sarcastic comments about Jackie's information. Leaving, Jackie tries to call Jimmy, who is driving south with loud music, and a car full of helium balloons.

Jackie then goes to see Jimmy's parents, who try to be polite but unhelpful. The cop makes veiled threats then notices a photo of granddaughters and a Miami address on the fridge door. Jackie leaves taking a teacup.

In church Jenny Rohr is introduced to Father Doyle, a recent transfer in from Ireland. Both priests listen as Jenny explains her marriage and sex problems. The older priest counsels patience and forgiveness, Jenny doesn't buy it but the priest says she should look at herself more than blaming her husband.

Det. Minogue is assigned to Captain Lewis to investigate the church shooting, neither is happy about it. Rohr then saunters in to talk about Ward and the Grand Jury, asking for the uniform cops to support Ward. Lewis says nobody wants a law and order black guy.

Ward and his boss Dey argue about the Grand Jury. Dey is puzzled about the Kinicki angle.

Frankie Ryan bandages his hand, he cut himself at work. Cathy is upset Jimmy is missing and the FBI was at the parents' house. Frankie suspects Jimmy is going to Florida to see his kids. Frankie wants to have sex but Cathy is on her period and not in the mood. Then she worries about the money and rushes to the washroom to count the cash behind the medicine cabinet. It's all there, but she wonders where Jimmy got money to travel with.

Det. Minogue shows Ward a murdered dead body, claiming the man was the church shooter. Ward doesn't believe it.

Rohr calls a Miami FBI agent he knows to visit Jimmy's ex, Corrie Struthers. The other cop eventually agrees.

Ward notices Rachel working late, she says she lives with her parents. Ward needs another witness for his Grand Jury.

Minogue asks Rev. Fields and Siobhan for more info on the shooting. Neither is helpful, Minogue gets angry.

Cathy goes to see her mother-in-law. The women bicker about Kick and Jimmy and their relative parenting skills.

Rachel spies on Sheik Sheehan, one of Frankie's gang.

Kick watches her dad Frankie fix the medicine cabinet. He kisses her lovingly.

Ward and Siobhan have breakfast. Rev. Fields has written a negative op-ed piece in the morning paper. Siobhan tells him to relax about Fields, she needs him for her Genesis Coalition.

Jackie is at the free clinic where the doctor tells Rohr he doesn't have herpes. Jackie then realizes his mother-in-law Rosa pranked him. At home he calls her out on it.

Captain Lewis visits Ward with the newspaper. Lewis is angry Fields is stirring up the anti-police rhetoric, Fields has many enemies in the cops.

Jenny visits an old friend Sue. Sue suggests a therapist or to get a job, perhaps go back to being a teacher.

Siobhan meets with Fields and suggests some change in his tactics, to nuance his message. She didn't like his "house nigger" comment about her husband.

Minogue sees witness Kayla on the street, she suggests she has info on Rev. Fields.

Rachel shows Hank Signe her file on Sheehan, he has a violent crime background and alcohol problems starting from the date of Kinicki's disappearance. Signe says they need a batter connection to Kinicki.

Granny Rosa calls upstairs to Jenny, handsome young Father Doyle has come to see her. They have coffee, Doyle apologizes for the meeting the other day. She wonders how she can start over again, he supplies some guidance.

Ward and Siobhan dress up for dinner with her mixed marriage parents. The parents are a little worried about Rev. Fields and talk about future grand-kids.

Rachel goes undercover to an AA meeting and chats to Sheehan. Sheehan mentions a friend of his went missing and is presumed dead.

Jenny sees Jackie sleeping on the sofa with empty beer bottles. He had smashed Rosa's Red Baron model plane.

Cathy Ryan calls Miami to warm Corrie that Jimmy may be coming. Struthers is alarmed to hear Jimmy is missing and may be on his way. The FBI visit Corrie looking for Jimmy.

Ward and Rachel explain that Sheehan is a witness in the Kinicki case. Ward is secretive about another informant, Rachel then realizes Ward is not being honest with the judge.

Jenny and Jackie dress in their bedroom, she wonders why he is upset with her mother, he doesn't say. She tells him she wants to go back to teaching, he puts her down referring to their party hearty daughter.

Ward explains to a Grand Jury the mechanics of the upcoming proceedings, there will be no judge and both he and the jurors can ask questions. He makes an emotional appeal for them to contribute to the judicial process despite what is in the media, and to bring closure to the Kinicki family.

Jimmy arrives at Corrie's house in Miami, his ex Is not happy to see him. The FBI arrives, Jimmy tries to escape but is taken down in the backyard. In jail, arrested for possession, he uses his one call to phone Jackie Rohr. Jackie is amused to have caught Jimmy and will let him sit for awhile.

description: Jackie strong-arms Jimmy to get a step closer to finding the armored truck guards. Decourcy rattles a suspect called to testify before the Grand Jury. Siobhan learns something unsettling about a leader of the Coalition.
tags: ['female full frontal nudity', 'female topless nudity']
synopsis_with_character_names:
S1E4

Jackie Rohr visits Jimmy Ryan in a cell down in Miami. Jackie is upset they didn't find the guards' bodies, Jimmy pleads that was what he thought. Jackie realizes Jimmy must know the killers.

Kick Ryan has another nightmare, worried about Uncle Jimmy. Frankie and Cathy soothe her.

Rachel and forensics techs examine the armored bank car recovered from the water. They realize there are military grade weapons involved.

Ward discusses the Miami trip with Jackie, Jackie says to get aggressive with the Grand Jury and Tommy Hayes. Rachel reports they found a bullet fragment. Ward decides to reconvene.

Rev. Fields meets with Siobhan. She asks that he respect her husband.

Jackie is assaulted by two muggers returning with a coffee to his car, they run off after seeing his badge leaving a bloody forehead.

Jenny is at a school signing in.

Siobhan meets Kayla, the witness from the church shooting. Kayla has a story about the Rev. and a trip to Haiti four years ago. At the beach, he made some suggestive comments about a bathing suit and photographs although nothing happened. Siobhan can't do much and urges Kayla to keep it quiet, or she'll be outcast.

A judge signs off on Ward's Grand Jury subpoena, warning him not to waste the effort.

Tommy and Sheehan meet Frankie at the market, Frankie says to stay cool and be forgetful at the Grand Jury, the two men are worried. After Sheehan leaves Frankie hints to Tommy he is worried their partner will talk.

At the school, Jenny goes to the gym. The young priest is happily helping out, they go for a walk in the garden. Father Doyle gives her some confidence in returning to teaching. He will arrange for her to get some experience at the school.

Tommy stops as he sees Jimmy Ryan on a street, he punches Jimmy in the gut and takes him to an alley to meet Frankie, Jimmy explains he met a woman and went to the Cape for few days. Frankie is upset he didn't stay in touch and adds Jimmy is off his meds. After Tommy leaves Jimmy says the woman he was with was an FBI agent's wife, explaining Rohr's interest.

Cathy Ryan meets Kick's teacher at the school. Kick has been sleeping in class and the teacher knows about the nightmares and fears. Cathy gets defensive as the teacher suggests counseling. Cathy leaves defiant.

Jackie arrives at the squad room to chat up Rachel. She notices his forehead and ask if he is OK. Rachel refuses his pass and goes back to work.

Ward and Siobhan chat about Rev. Fields, he wonders why she supports him. He refuses to help her help him.

Cathy has a sit down with Kick at home about school and urges her daughter to open up, the girl just wants to watch TV, Cathy slaps her and Kick runs to her bedroom.

Jenny announces to the family she will start teaching two days a week. Jackie smiles to himself, Jenny feels put down.

Frankie and Cathy rest after sex. Cathy updates him on Kick, they start arguing about a therapist, he thinks it is a good idea.

Ward comes to see Capt. Lewis about Rev. Fields and any rumors. The precinct Captain chuckles and hums a ditty.

Jackie happens to use the same restaurant washroom as Father Doyle and asks why the interest in Jenny. The priest says he was just counseling. Jackie won't let up and keeps asking aggressively. Jackie warns him to stay away from Jenny.

The Grand Jury convenes and is sworn in. Ward makes his opening statement then starts questioning Tommy Hayes. They go over his income and Kelly Kinicki. Tommy saw Kelly the night he went missing at the Ebbtide Bar. Tommy responds to each query with confidence.

Jackie says to double down on the next guy. Jackie then asks a tech to run a trace and slips the man a package. Jackie teases Ward for trying to play a tough guy.

Rev. Fields introduces Siobhan at a public meeting. They want to hear ideas on how to improve things. Ward arrives as Fields lectures about the need to fight back. A young man speaks up, a story about Tiffany Moore, shot by a stray bullet. Siobhan recalls the case, Tiffany was only 12.

Jenny enters a classroom. Father Doyle says there is a problem with insurance and she cannot teach. Jenny realizes Jackie came to see him, she leaves sadly.

Siobhan plans with Rev. Fields. She asks about Kayla and the Haiti trip. He says he was misunderstood.

Jimmy uses a pay phone. Vito the bookie comes ups behind him, with a cryptic message from Jackie, Jimmy promises to find out who murdered the guards.

Father Doyle gives his sermon about Job, Jackie watches and adds an envelope to the offering plate. Jenny is depressed.

Ward grills Sheehan at the Grand Jury. He asks about Hughes and Kinicki.

Jimmy asks Frankie what Tommy said at the Grand Jury, so he can get his story straight as he is next. Jimmy probes about the car robbery in Revere, Frankie deflects, but hints the Ebbtide is the place for drugs and guns.

Back at the Grand Jury, Ward brings up the Revere Armored Car robbery. He explains the case to the jury, taunting Sheehan who gets angry and tries to attack the prosecutor, then is dragged away by bailiffs.

Cathy tells Frankie Sheehan was arrested. They will look after his family with cash.

Ward and his team laugh about the Sheehan Jury incident over drinks. Rachel warns Jackie about his breaking the chain of evidence rules. She then gets a call from the FBI lab tech, the bullet fragment was from an AK-47. Jackie is happy he was right. After the others leave he stays behind at the bar.

description: Jackie and Decourcy continue to hunt down the weapon connected to the Revere robbery. Local reporter gets a tip that could lead her down a treacherous path. Siobhan questions whether doing what is right is ultimately what is for the best.
tags: ['female nudity']
synopsis_with_character_names:
S1 E5

Jackie arrives at the squad room crowing about the AK-47 and teasing Hank Signa why the State Police haven't found the weapon yet. Signa fires right back. At the elevator Rohr meets Minogue, their mutual dislike erupts and they curse each other, Minogue lands a parting shot that hits home, Jackie pauses in thought after the other leaves.

Jimmy weeps as he sees Frankie's kids playing outside, he takes a few pills, dabs his eyes and goes inside the Ryan house. Frankie is tired and napping on the sofa. Jimmy tries to talk about Tommy and Sheehan, Frankie says it's under control, not in the mood to discuss. Jimmy says the family should all take off while the Grand Jury is on, and asks for another heist. Frankie gets angry but young daughter Kick interrupts them.

FBI Agent Clasby, the one with Jackie Rohr at the funeral, meets reporter Michaela Freda at a restaurant, he will provide off-the-record info as his penance for past misdeeds. He gives her the name Clay Roach as a lead.

Jenny comes home after class, Rosa complements her new hair tint, Jackie eating dinner appears not to notice. Rosa mentions the daughter has not come home since the previous night, Jenny is worried but Jackie seems confident the girl is fine. Jackie leaves, dropping another shot at Father Doyle.

Jackie meets Jimmy at a harbor, who says the Ebbtide bartender sells guns to a black guy working for the gas company.

Decourcy reads the AK-47 report and updates Siobhan over a glass of wine. She doesn't understand the Charlestown code of silence. She has a meeting with Capt. Lewis and her bosses in the morning.

Reporter Freda goes to a modest house, Clay Roach's mother. Clay is inside watching TV. Freda wonders how he got off the cop shooting. She wants to know his contact at the FBI or else her story will name him. He says to talk to D.A. Ward.

Sue comes to visit Jenny for coffee. Jenny asks about Sue's daughter, they had sent her to a private school so no delinquency problems.

At the Mass Power & Gas Offices the supervisor knows who the meter reader is Jackie and Ward have come to find out about but asks for a warrant. Ward says he can get a court order if needed, then the supervisor relents and gives them the info. Ward starts to realize many of their activities are illegal for police, Jackie rationalizes for him.

Signa and Rachel are assigned to tail the meter guy. On stakeout, she explains she recently dated a K9 Officer.

Siobhan has the brief meeting with Lewis and her bosses. Lewis gives a file on Rev. Fields, Siobhan is told to check out each claim.

Rachel and Signa continue to bond, as they follow the gas company van. The driver delivers a long slender package to a barber shop. Hank says they need a warrant.

Kick meets the school Counselor, she is sad as he probes for what's behind her issues.

The meter guy finally drives home, the cops are surprised he lives in a decent neighborhood with a cheerful little daughter. Rachel reveals she has an Iranian background and took the State job for the security, but is not sure where she "fits in".

A young woman and her son come to Siobhan's office. The boy is taken to the kitchen while the woman explains she was in the church choir. When she was age 16, Rev. Fields trapped her in a coat check room and forced her to sing a hymn. At home later she tells Decourcy he was right. Fields is a predator of sorts, he says push him aside from her Coalition.

Signa and Rachel update Rohr on Jensen the gas man. They arrested him but he won't talk. Hank wants Jackie's help but warns him not to screw it up.

Cathy Ryan arrives at school, angry. The counselor tells her Kick's troubles seem related to a death in the family. He show's a drawing Kick drew.

Jackie blocks a parole officer in the parking lot. He asks for Clay Roach, the man refuses to help, Jackie has to let him go.

Signa and Ward meet Michaela, she asks about Clay Roach and gives Signa her pager number. Signa warns Ward he should worry about the reporter.

Frankie Ryan gets his young son for a bath, the water is cold. They have no money for a plumber. Kick sees her mother with the drawing, Cathy sees the hidden words "F*** this" written upside down, tries to get the girl to explain with no success.

Jackie and Ward meet, the ADA mentions Freda and asks how Jackie got Minogue to change his testimony, Jackie deflects. Ward says there have been 45 murders in Roxbury this year, he's the only black prosecutor in Suffolk County but working overtime on the three white cops case. Jackie cheers him up with a story about Abe Lincoln.

Frankie puts his boy in the cold water, unable to repair the boiler. He promises the boy better times.

Jackie finds Roach in a flophouse in Roxbury, he demands to know where Jensen stores the guns. Clay is strung out, needing a fix, Jackie gives a white powder. Clay tells Jackie off, but the drug given only makes him feel worse. Jackie offers the real stuff. Clay gives an address.

The Ward's and Hastings enjoy watching Bill Clinton debate on TV. Decourcy admits to being a Jerry Brown supporter. The talk turns to Rev. Fields, Eloise tells Siobhan to forget the accusations against Fields as they need the Rev. on the Coalition. Decourcy argues against that and his mother-in-law storms out. Decourcy suspects Siobhan hasn't told him everything about Fields and is upset she may have her own agenda.

Rohr calls Ward a little later, saying he found the rat and the address. In the morning DA Nathan Rey tells Ward to get the Strike Force Team involved. He goes to the team offices in the basement. Minogue drops by to say he wants to be "first in" on the Bromley Heath thing. Commander Chris Caysen is a sharp leader and has already checked up on Ward. They agree Hank Signa and the State Troopers will be backup.

The police Strike Team arrive at the site in a NYNEX cube van, piling out quickly with a door ram and weapons. Signa and Rachel watch from their car. Ward and Rohr watch from another car. The cops move in, Minogue fires on entering the door but is hit in the chest with a burst from an automatic weapon. The shooter is killed and two others are taken prisoner. Minogue is in rough shape as everyone comes in to view the scene. The weapon with the banana clip is in the dead man's hands. Jackie is happy they have the AK-47 and decides to ride the ambulance with Minogue. He lays into the mortally wounded cop with vulgar cruelty, Minogue flat lines looking at a grinning Jackie Rohr.

Jenny returns home to greet her mom. Daughter Benedetta went out again, three nights in a row. Jackie is having sex with his gf but can't ejaculate. He gets up and the girl shows a positive pregnancy test. He gives her some cash to get an abortion, he doesn't want another kid.

Betty Rohr is drinking in a park with some friends. A man offers a hit of marijuana and sits down beside her, Clay Roach.

description: Decourcy is a step closer to connecting the stolen guns to the Revere robbery when an insider agrees to talk. Jenny no longer can ignore Jackie's indiscretions after they show up on her doorstep. Money problems worsen for the Ryan family.
synopsis_with_character_names:
S1 E6

The cops inventory the weapons from the Bromley Heath raid. The men captured have prior arrests. Ward and Rohr debate black and white, Roxbury and Charlestown. Rachel Benham arrives with a ballistics update, the 7.62mm fragment has not been matched to the seized AK-47. The team is discouraged but Jackie says not to tell the Grand Jury yet under the assumption the lab will come back with a positive match. Rachel shakes her head. Ward looks closer at one of the arrested and realizes he knows the young man.

Ward visits the man, Ziba Pippin, and tries to get him to turn, threatening 15 years in jail. Ward tells him he knows him from church and talks about Pippin's mother Delia. Ward is prepared to convict her for selling stolen articles from her food market job. Ziba goes silent then confirms a man named Hook sold the guns to Jensen the gas meter reader. Outside the room Jackie is impressed.

Cathy Ryan has her mother-in law Dottie over, they bicker about the hot water boiler repairs. Dottie has an attack of sorts and can't breathe. Frankie arrives at the hospital, his mom in ICU, his dad is explains she smokes and drinks too much, with high blood pressure and diabetes. With no insurance Richy is worried how to pay the medical bills now. Frankie says he can fix it.

Hook is interviewed but calmly demands a lawyer. Ward makes sure he sees the two men arrested for gun trafficking, Jensen and Pippin but the bar owner remains silent.

Frankie brings flowers for his mom, Jimmy comes shortly after with a beer under his jacket. Dottie likes the younger son. Frankie is exasperated and goes to phone his boss to change a work shift. The boss tells Frankie that Hook was arrested, Frankie thinks in silence. He tells Jimmy.

At dinner, Jenny Rohr happily reports getting an A+ on her Jung-Freud paper, mother Rosa toasts her, daughter Benny seems puzzled. The door bell rings repeatedly, Jackie goes to the door, his girl friend Yvette is there talking about the baby. Jenny brings the young lady inside then goes ballistic and kicks Jackie out of the house. Jackie goes to a nice hotel and shares a joke with the doorman.

Reporter Michaela Freda runs into Rachel in a hallway and tries to get the cop to talk. Rachel is hostile and refuses to help, and realizes Freda had a previous relationship with Jackie Rohr. In the squad room she explains to Hank Signa and Ward and removes her hoop earrings, too similar to the ones Freda wears. Signa thinks the other weapons in the raid may be from an Armory heist in Georgia, Ward decides to call ATF.

Jenny tries to talk with Benny but the daughter is upset and decides to live with Jackie when the parents divorce. Jenny blows up and tells her to go ahead.

Jackie invites Rosa to the hotel dining room, the mother-in-law is impressed. He wants to return home, plays the humble sorrowful act but she lays out her terms. She wants her drivers incense back, taken away for an accident, and more fine port wine.

Ward and Signa meet the local ATF Agent, the fed is afraid of leaks in Suffolk County and doesn't want to help, Ward threatens to go over his head pretending he knows the man's boss. The ATF guy agrees to help.

Rosa and Jenny share a wine, Rose starts suggesting it is better to let Jackie return and lists a number of reasons. Jenny is confused and can't decide.

Andre Benjamin, one of the lawyers on the Coalition comes to see Decourcy about Reverend Fields and Siobhan. Fields is bad mouthing Siobhan and calling her a liar. Ward thanks him.

The Ryan's are waiting outside surgery. Frankie and Jimmy start cursing each other loudly, Cathy cannot get them to stop, their dad shrugs having given up with them long ago.

The team brainstorms about the AK-47, Jackie thinks Vietnam as a source and sure enough Hook's brother was in the Marines.

Cathy gives Dottie a hairdo and makeup in recovery. They chat about being wives to criminals. Dottie explains how it started for them, they have to do whatever it takes, the money needed to survive.

Michaela Freda tries to see Hank Signa while he is playing basketball with his son in a park. They talk a bit, Freda wants to get Jackie Rohr into Walpole Prison.

Rev. Fields arrives at Ward's office. Fields stresses the rumors are not true but Ward stands behind Siobhan. The talk gets heated and Fields lands a punch on Ward's cheek, the ADA rubs his face and asks if Fields will try the other cheek. Fields leaves.

Jackie goes to a bar and introduces himself to Hook's brother Ralph, pretending to be a buddy of the bartender Hook. Jackie mentions he is a vet and the two begin to connect over Kahlua and Jack.

Siobhan comes home, angry with Decourcy for the incident with Fields, she doesn't want him solving her problems. She notices his bruised face and gets ice. He stresses she has to get Fields removed.

Jackie and Ralph Hook are in a drunken argument with others in the bar about a Bruins game years ago. A brawl erupts. Later Jackie gets his new buddy back to his flat. The man is in his cups, poor and depressed. Jackie mentions AK47s, Ralph sold one of those too, then gets suspicious and changes the subject. Jackie then goes to see the bartender Hook in jail, explaining he met the man's brother. Rohr will get the brother kicked off veterans benefits. Hook finally agrees to talk and requests his lawyer again.

A Truant Officer comes to see Jenny, Benny has not been in school for three days.

Jimmy calls his ex Corie, pleading for his mom to see her grandkids, he promises he won't be in a Boston when Corie arrives. She agrees if he sends tickets.

Jenny is frantic and goes to her daughter's friend Gail. Gail's mother is there mowing the lawn, angry with Jenny for raising Benny as a bad influence and for throwing her husband Jackie out of the house. The woman reveals Benny has been hanging around with a scummy guy.

Clay Roach shoots Benny up with a needle at his flophouse, she takes it in the arm willingly, then collapses on the floor mattress. Roach sighs and calls another guy to the room.

Siobhan tells the Coalition Board she will out the Reverend. The Board murmurs and don't seem to like the idea. Fields arrives, the room rises to face him.

Jackie is in Ward's office nursing his hangover. The meeting with Hook's lawyer is tomorrow. Jackie gets a call, Jenny reports she can't find Benny. Jackie puts out a BOLO right away to Dispatch, Ward offers help. Outside Michaela confronts Jackie who loudly tells her off.

Jimmy and Frankie open the medicine cabinet to see the cash, the pile is much smaller. Frankie agrees to steal something.

Jackie enters a high rise with an ambulance outside. The responders point him to Benny, partially nude passed out, he covers her with his coat, carrying her outside. In the hospital Jenny wonders who would do that to Benny, Jackie tells her to go on home, he'll stay. Jenny offers to let him come back home, but he has to sleep on the sofa. Alone in the chapel, Jackie has a smoke and curses a figure of Christ.

description: With the gang's arms dealer in custody, Jackie thinks he's a step closer to glory. But Decourcy is the one in a position to negotiate, and he's considering cutting off the gun supply rather than going after the buyers.
synopsis_with_character_names:
S1 E7

A woman falls and rolls down a staircase landing with a bloody face. Michaela Freda.

Jackie is woken from sleep on the sofa. Jenny has changed her mind and wants him out again, Jackie protests and says it will be good for Benny to see them together as she is coming home that day. Jackie tells Jenny the daughter doesn't want to see her mother at the pickup, Jenny is upset.

Rachel Benham sees a pensive Rohr looking out of an office window, she teases him about showing up before noon. She is working on files on the Ebbtide Bar. Rachel wonders why Freda dislikes him, he says the reporter is a victim of her own bad karma and is in a coma, chuckling. A short time later Rachel mentions the incident to Ward and Signa, busy, they shrug it off as just Jackie. A polished suit arrives, Seth Golden, Steve 'Sky' Hook's lawyer.

Jimmy and Frankie Ryan go to their local liquor store, Jimmy excited about them robbing again. A thief comes in to rob the store, the Ryans help the Owner by taking the robber down and lay their boots to him.

At the hospital Cathy Ryan sees a friend in the tuck shop. Babsie Kinicki is the cashier and is wary of the Grand Jury, Cathy expresses her sorrow for Babsie losing her husband Kelly.

The lawyers negotiate but can't agree, Golden leaves with an F-bomb. Signa wonders how Hook could afford a "Harvard Jew". Signa then tries to get Ward to look for a positive spin.

Sue visits Jenny to give her some confidence. Sue admits her own daughter, far from perfect, was in rehab for cocaine, she urges Jenny to mainly listen and not lecture.

Siobhan has a coffee with a young lady, she reports Rev. Fields has been removed from the church and the Coalition. Adrienne is furious though, wanting Fields to be punished even more.

Jackie picks up his daughter, black eye and despondent. He probes a bit about drugs and counseling. Benny is worried she won't get better, is afraid to talk to her mom. Jackie gives her a hug and tries to cheer her up, the girl bravely walks rather than take a wheelchair.

Ward meets Golden again, Hook will only give names of two gun dealers and stresses Ward would make a mistake taking Hook to a Grand Jury. Ward accepts the deal and leaves with names; Tompkins and Sammarco. He goes to strike team leader Chris Caysen to plan a raid. Caysen is puzzled, hasn't heard of them.

Frankie and Jimmy go to the Ebbtide, Hook is back behind the bar. Hook refuses to sell them guns this time and is not so friendly.

Jackie is upset over Ward's deal, giving up on the three missing guards, for small time gun runners. The two bicker over the strategy. Jackie fumes and says he will solve the guards' case himself.

Jenny comes to Benny's room with a small gift, and offers to listen. Jenny tries to engage and Benny reveals the guy's name "Clay".

Dottie and Richy watch TV in the hospital, Cathy brings Kick for a visit but the girl is hesitant and quiet, they take her downstairs for a snack. In the cafe they meet Babsie Kinicki and her son Miles. The kids greet each other, Kick wants to go. Cathy explains Kick is hung up on Kelly Kinicki and maybe she should learn the truth, Richy advises against it.

Rachel goes to the newspaper to see Michaela Freda's editor. The woman refuses to give Freda's notes without a warrant. Rachel suspects the editor doesn't even have the notes.

At the school playground Miles and Kick run into each other again. Kick is sorry about his dad, Miles turns cold and calls her a bitch. She responds by taking out a box cutter and cutting his basketball. Cathy and Kick are the brought before a female cop who tries to find out what happened and why. Det. Bernie Hannahan from Charlestown arrives and dismisses the other cop, he talks to Cathy alone. He's angry and tells Cathy to get her house in order, control Kick.

Jenny is in class as the group discusses Freudian sexuality. She listens intently then leaves the class abruptly without participating, rushing to the washroom to splash her face with cold water, gasping.

Jimmy and Frankie go to another gun dealer and order handguns and rifles for Friday. They shake on it.

Jackie phones someone looking for Jimmy Ryan, the voice suggests the hospital. Rohr snorts a line while on the phone.

Rachel brings flowers to the hospital, Freda is in a coma tended by her sister. Rachel makes up a story, and offers to sit and watch while the other grabs a bite in the cafeteria. When alone, Rachel finds Freda's notebook in the patient's personal effects bag. Back at the office she pours through the book, reading about Agent Clasby and Clay Roach. Rachel suspects Jackie may be a felon.

Corie Struthers arrives from Florida with the young girls to see Dottie. Dottie hints Jimmy is coming, stressing Jimmy is loving and loyal, Corie dislikes his drug use. Jimmy arrives and greets his daughters with a big smile. Corie has a private word with Jimmy until an orderly comes to lead him away. Jimmy finds Jackie Rohr waiting for him in an empty room. Rohr demands more information on the three guards. Jimmy threatens to go to the press and tell his story, Jackie leaves with a firm demand.

Siobhan talks to Decourcy in their apartment. Both are stressed but have a tea and hold hands.

The strike team raids a house, they arrest college kids with a fridge full of cash. Ward goes to see Nathan Rey. The boss laughs at the raid as the kids were just running a website. Both young men Tompkins and Sammarco, have establishment parents, one a Councillor, and Rey says give them two years suspended sentence with no publicity. Ward is frustrated.

Back at home Ward pours a whiskey and wants to watch TV. He kisses Siobhan, she asks about Chris Caysen who wants to work with the Coalition. Decourcy vouches for Caysen, she is worried he would be wrong as a white cop. Ward then wonders if he did right with the guns, she agrees he did well to stop some gun traffic. Decourcy has doubts.

Jackie tells Vito Lupo, the Bookie, to scare Jimmy, as they watch the Ryan house. Vito doesn't like the idea. Inside Cathy reads a book for the small kids, Jimmy and Corie enjoy an episode of Who's the Boss on TV. Kick is coming home late and notices a man sitting in Jimmy's car near her home. She tells Frankie in the kitchen. Frankie goes out and gets in the car, he recognizes Lupo but is puzzled. Lupo pulls a gun, the men struggle, a shot goes off inside the car. Cathy pauses hearing the gunshot. Jimmy is oblivious. Kick also heard something.

Frankie takes the gun and leaves the dead man in the car. Kick sees his bloody shirt, they hug. Frankie then gets Jimmy and wonders why Lupo was there. Jimmy says he will take care of it and drives away in the car. He goes to a dark forest area, Jackie pulls up behind him. The Lupo killing will be kept quiet if Jimmy reveals the three dead bank guards.

At an underpass the oil barrels are recovered from the river. Once open, Jackie points out to Ward they are looking for someone who killed and dismembered three men, so no more games.

description: Jackie celebrates a win in front of cameras but, behind closed doors, reaches a new low. A shining moment from Decourcy promises a potential future in politics, but any pride Siobhan feels for her husband is squandered by a betrayal.
tags: ['man in a shower', 'male in a shower', 'shower', 'taking a shower', 'bare chested male', 'clothed female naked male scene', 'implied nudity', 'implied male nudity', 'embarrassing nudity', 'embarrassing male nudity']
synopsis_with_character_names:
S1 E8

Jackie is interviewed on TV and takes all the credit for the bodies' recovery for the FBI. Hank, Rachel and Decourcy watch, not pleased Rohr neglected to mention the State Police or DA's office. Rachel says she doesn't have enough on Jackie yet.

Jimmy and Corie chat while the Ryan kids go wild in the house. Cathy comes in and tries to restore order, looking for Frankie. Upstairs, he just finished a shower, Cathy is alarmed the guards were found. Frankie is not worried.

Ward interviews Sheik Sheehan in jail, trying to get the guards' killer identified, Sheehan won't budge.

Jackie goes home to get clean clothes, Rosa is vacuuming and the two trade insults.

Jenny is leaving College and notices a woman cursing at a broken down car. She offers a ride to Rachel. The two talk about their lousy husbands but as Rachel tries to ask too much about Jackie and a trip to Miami, Jenny gets suspicious and kicks Benham of the car.

Ward has Sheehan up in front of the Grand Jury. They start asking if he an an alibi for the Jan 8 day of the Revere armored car heist. He claims he drove his city vehicle to the horse track that day, got drunk and left it there. Ward charges him with misappropriation of government property, up to five years in jail. Outside he gives the bad news to Mrs. Sheehan and a lawyer. Ward then tells Hank Signa to get Tommy Hayes again.

Tommy, Frankie and another gang member Joe Nazzarin chat about Sheehan at a bar. Nazz suggests they all leave town for awhile, Frankie and Tommy laugh at the idea as being chicken, and leave a threat hanging.

Benham and Signa go to the Hayes house looking for Tommy. The wife is busy with three young kids and calls Rachel out for being a fake Bostonian. Tommy is not there.

Tara Sheehan goes to see Cathy Ryan, worried her husband will be sent up. She asks for more money, Cathy resists but agrees to increase the $500 week cash by $100. Cathy suggests Tara needs another plan if Sheik is imprisoned.

Yvette goes to see Jenny, upset Jackie is ignoring her and the pregnancy.

Decourcy and Siobhan host a cocktail party for progressive, wealthy liberals. A gay man gets Ward to, make a speech, he extemporizes a unity and change talk to a round of applause.

Jackie is watching porn as Jenny comes to his hotel room. She urges him to take care of Yvette, he promises to do so. As Jenny starts to tell him about Rachel in the car, a hooker arrives, Jenny leaves in disgust.

After the party, Todd Hastings says the Party will see where he fits in. His mother-in-law Eloise suggests Mayor is a dead end and Governor or Senator would be better. The in-laws leave and a tired Siobhan takes Decourcy to bed.

Corie comes to see Cathy, neither can sleep and they chat in a dark living room. Corie's father is in prison also, she desperately wants to leave Boston behind.

Jackie calls home and tells Rosa he put Yvette on a plane. Rosa lets slip Benny is at Rehab, Jenny gets up to get there before Jackie.

Ward goes to see Tara Sheehan. She won't talk but he reveals he knows she has been getting $500 a week from somewhere. Tara stresses she gambles.

Jackie arrives at the Rehab and compliments the attractive front desk lady. She refuses to let him in as he is not on the List. Rohr gets angry and tries to use his badge to get in. Jenny arrives and tells him to go away.

Hank and Rachel have lunch in a nice Persian Restaurant. They talk shop, Rachel has put out a BOLO on Tommy Hayesa and she will look into Jackie's trip to Florida, thinking it is about Clay Roach. Ward arrives and takes Hank's seat as he leaves to look into Charlestown bookies.

Frankie picks up his three kids from school and takes them to a beach for sodas and to watch the planes take off and land at the airport. He wishes they look after each other when they grow up and to go away to see the world.

Hank talks to a bookie, the man reveals the names of other bookies Vito Lupo, possibly retired?, and Richy Ryan.

Rachel goes to an apartment knocking on Clay Roach's door. A neighbor says he is gone and could be anywhere. At the office, Rachel calls Miami-Dade asking if Roach was in custody and if Jackie Rohr was there. She reports to Signa Tommy Hayes is still missing, Hank has an update for Ward. The three sit together in Ward's office, Signa explains about Richy Ryan and his two sons Frankie and Jimmy. Jimmy has minor public intox. busts and was a drinking buddy of Sheik Sheehan. Jimmy's main file is sealed though indicating he may be a Confidential Informant. Hank has checked and it is not BPD, Suffolk County or State, leaving only the FBI. Ward says to tail Jimmy Ryan to find out who he snitches for.

Frankie meets Det. Brian Hannahan at a bar. Frankie brings up some past robberies made by bad cops and makes some elliptical references to Larry Bird's retirement.

Ward meets Sheehan's lawyer and asks him to mention Jimmy Ryan at the Grand Jury. The lawyer says that would be illegal and refuses, leaving Sheehan in custody.

Siobhan helps the new preacher unpack, a woman returning to her roots. Capt. Shag Lewis arrives to say hello, Siobhan is hostile and didn't like his methods with the previous Rev. Lewis says her husband knew what he was up to.

Ward and Rohr meet at the elevator. Ward is still bitter about Jackie's media appearances, Jackie is angry that Ward did not follow their agreement, he leaves with an f-bomb.

Corie and Jimmy put the kids to sleep. Cathy and Frankie talk in their bedroom, Cathy doesn't like the idea of another heist now. Frankie says they will frame another crew for it. Corie packs to leave the next day. Jimmy offers to drive them to Florida and wants to reconnect. The two start kissing, Corie seems to want to have sex but then reveals she is engaged to be married in Miami. Jimmy is taken aback and leaves the house cursing. He goes to a bar and drowns his sorrow. He has a line of coke and fights with other men on the street. Signa and Benham watch from a car as Jimmy is beaten up. Jimmy staggers to a phone booth and calls Rohr for a meeting.

At an underground garage Jimmy meets Jackie and confesses to killing the three guards. Jackies laughs it off and is then angry Jimmy wasted his time. The FBI cop drives off as Hank and Rachel watch it all with interest from their car.

Ward drives home listening to rap. At home, Siobhan is furious Decourcy worked with Capt Lewis behind her back to get Fields ousted. She gives him a pillow to sleep with on the sofa.

The gang discuss the heist in the Ryan's kitchen. Jimmy is nervous that Tommy is missing, Frankie and Brian say relax. Hannahan has a hair sample taken in evidence to plant and point the police at another gang. Brian comments on Jimmy's bruises.

Jenny and Jackie have a civil talk about Benny. Jenny says the girl has deep shame over the assault and mentions the boy's name "Clay". Jackie leaves immediately and drives to an apartment complex. He breaks in the door to a flat and surprises a groggy Clay Roach on the sofa. Clay is puzzled then sees the gun and admits he interfered with Rohr's daughter. Roach makes a crude oral sex comment and Jackie shoots him in the face.

description: When an unlikely source confides in Decourcy, the Massachusetts State Police hatch a plan that promises arrests without the help of the FBI. However, keeping out of the way is not exactly Jackie's strong suit.
synopsis_with_character_names:
S1 E9

Jackie comes to a guy at a burn barrel and dumps in some clothes. He chats with the guy, this was where the Rohrs old family home was before his mother burned it.

Frankie picks up his guns from the dealer, the dealer takes a verbal shot at Jimmy.

Siobhan and Decourcy get dressed for work, still cool. Decourcy apologizes but his wife is still irritated.

Signa and Benham still tail Jimmy, waiting for him to do something. The Ryans greet Dottie returning home, the cops watch. Rachel wants to look for Roach and leaves Hank in the car. She goes back to the apartment, and enters as the door is ajar. She sees the dead body and enters the flat warily.

Jackie goes home to a quiet house, he finds Benedetta dressed and lying in an empty tub. Jackie weeps and hugs his daughter. Jenny returns home, Jackie agrees to the Vermont Rehab.

Jimmy goes through old belongings in his parents' basement. He prepares a noose to hang himself. Richy comes down and sees what is going on. Richy tries to settle his son down.

Chris Caysen and Siobhan talk to a public meeting about a new approach. Nathan Rey is in the audience being very negative and calling for tough status quo law and order, Decourcy is there and opposes his boss.

Sue and Jenny have a wine together, Jenny announces she will divorce Jackie. Sue gives her a hug, and gets her a good lawyer. Sue gives more helpful instructions.

Siobhan is happier at home after the successful meeting. They kiss again.

Rachel is puzzled, the Roach death looks like a suicide. She is suspicious though as it looks like a setup.

Jackie takes a quick line before knocking on the Ward's door. Siobhan wonders what he is up to. She notices his nasal drip, Jackie quickly excuses himself.

Jenny wonders why Rosa doesn't seem happy Benedetta is going away. There is some tension, Rosa blames Jenny returning to school for it all.

The cops continue to tail Jimmy, he goes to a bar. They continue to bond with small talk and sharing their pasts. Hannahan arrives at the bar and sends Jimmy off on an errand, to boost the get-away-car. Jimmy goes out to steal an old sedan, Signa pulls up and arrests him.

Ward has Jimmy in an interview room and goes back to Kinicki's disappearance. Jimmy doesn't know anything or anything about Tommy Hayes, but the two finally talk about Jackie Rohr. Jimmy reveals there will be another robbery and he needs to be released to steal the car.

Dottie comes to see Cathy busy with the books, the kids are out playing. Dottie reveals Jimmy tried to kill himself, so Cathy can tell Frankie. Frankie won't listen to his mother.

Rachel approaches Agent Clasby as he is leaving his home. She asks about Clay Roach, knows Clasby is connected. The FBI Agent walks away as she warns him Roach is dead.

Jackie is in his office as a coworker asks if he will sign a retirement card. He gets up when he hears who it is for. He goes to see Clasby in the cafeteria and is upset his old partner is quitting. Clasby is still sad at recent FBI integrity issues.

The Ryans have breakfast, Kick wants to see the planes again, Frankie says he has other better spots. The kids go to school happily, Frankie will pick them up. Jimmy says goodbye too, Cathy asks if took his meds. Frankie knows Jimmy tried to kill himself and suggests Jimmy sit this one out. Jimmy says Frankie should sit it out instead.

Jenny does homework but can't concentrate. She goes to the College and tells a younger male co-student she is dropping out. Soon they are kissing on a sofa, Jenny stops it. The guy agrees to just talk. She reveals Jackie may have killed her abusive father. Her mother Rosa knew but didn't seem to stop the abuse.

Frankie goes over the plans with the gang. They have a crew cab pickup truck. Hank explains to Ward how the cops will stake out the scene. Ward has made sure the FBI has not been invited. Jackie is happier in Ward's office but Decourcy needs to run an packs his briefcase. Jackie rifts through Ward's desk and is surprised the office is quiet. He sees Rey and asks what is going on. After some insults, Rey reveals something is going down in Fall River. Jackie calls dispatch to find out where Signa and Benham are.

The gang drives to their target, Jimmy bickers with Nazz. The cops are in the Brinks Truck. Jackie leads a four car FBI squad towards the target also. The armored car pulls up to a bank, the back up cops park close by. The gang loads their ammo clips. Cathy watches the clock nervously. She blows up at her employee.

Signa and Benham have bullet proof vests waiting in the Brinks car. The black truck arrives and parks behind, the gang in their hockey masks come out armed. Hank gets out with his shotgun to face them, the gang retreat. Jackie arrives and rams the pickup truck to prevent escape. The truck is surrounded. Nazz goes out firing his Mac-10, Signa is hit but the other cops riddle Nazz with bullets. Hannahan goes out pretending to be a hostage and saying he is Boston PD. Frankie and Jimmy are arrested. Hank bleeds out but is taken away by ambulance. Ward is furious with Rohr, Jackie is confident and talks back. The Ryans sit quietly, handcuffed in the back of a cop car. Cathy picks up the kids at school, Kick realizes something has happened.

Rachel and Ward wait at the hospital, they watch Jackie on TV again realizing 1% of cops are bad. Rachel says she can help with Jackie. A doctor waits to give a report.

At home Siobhan is bubbly then realizes how somber Decourcy is as he arrives home. Cathy Ryan watches the TV News announce the death of Hank Signa. Kick comes to see her mother, she can't sleep. They watch Jackie on TV, Cathy hugs her daughter. The FBI barge in, Jackie waving a search warrant. Kick tells Jackie F-You.

description: Jackie celebrates another moment in the spotlight. Decourcy considers the best course of action to carry out justice for the murdered guards. Jimmy is desperate to weasel his way out of his mess, even if jeopardizing his brother's future.
synopsis_with_character_names:
S1 E10

Cathy Ryan walks through her house, a tossed over mess since the search warrant. Richy Ryan helps with the kids. She scrambles to answer the phone. Tommy Hayes is calling to say he is sorry, Cathy is furious cursing him out, Tommy pleads that Jimmy is the rat. In a van cops listen in by wiretap.

At a full police funeral for Hank Signa, Amazing Grace sounds by a bagpiper. Jackie Rohr wheels up, gets a call and tells the other party to pick up Tommy Hayes. Ward glares at Rohr, who retreats to his car. In Western New York a squad of FBI arrest Hayes in a motel room.

At the wake after the cops share drinks. Ward steps out of the bar to see Rohr on the sidewalk, slightly drunk. Jackie gives Decourcy a flask with a quote by Muhammad Ali etched on, saying it was found in Hank's effects. Ward is sad for trusting Rohr. Jackie has a personal anecdote about growing up wondering how blacks can sing happily in church. Both men separate taking deep bites from their flasks. Back in the bar Rachel is still angry with Jackie.

Jackie meets the US Attorney and recommends they let Suffolk County have the Ryans. The Feds will take the glory for the arrests but Jackie asks to let Ward handle the trial, so he can have some good press too. The US Attorney agrees as a favor to be owed by Jackie.

Jimmy Ryan tells Ward he wants blanket immunity. Rey and Benham watch the interview, Rey thinks Ward is trying to solve everything. In the interview room Jimmy thinks he has the upper-hand as Ward needs him to close the three dead guards. Later Jackie comes to see Jimmy in the cells, wondering what he told Ward. Jackie makes a veiled threat but Jimmy counters with threats to talk about FBI informants and the Bulgers. Jackie leaves cursing.

In a drizzle Jackie meets Jenny, she wonders how he was able to cheat on her, she couldn't even do it. Jackie claims he is tormented by his sins and self-loathing.

Rachel comes to see Rey with a photocopy, she has learned the FBI is selling the guns taken in the Fall River arrests. Rey says it is common, the Signa family will get a share of the proceeds, all families accept the money.

Jenny waits for her mother Rosa, she fiddles with another of Rosa's model planes. Jenny slowly winds up her anger and both women hurl the past at each other. Jenny blames her mother for her life and starts breaking the model planes. Jenny then demands Rosa get out and tells her to leave by tomorrow.

Jackie goes to see Decourcy, prepping for the trial. Jackie says it will be easy but Ward wonders how to get the three Revere guards into the case. Jackie says to lie, steal, cheat to get what he wants and has another anecdote. Ward asks if Jimmy Ryan should be given immunity, Jackie says not to as Jimmy is unreliable.

Rachel comes to see Ward, saying he is working too hard. Ward asks her what she has on Jackie, and asks if he should give Jimmy immunity. She says to do the opposite of what Jackie says.

In Court, Ward has Jimmy on the stand. Jimmy admits to many robberies and then stuns everyone by saying Frankie killed the guards in Revere. Frankie's lawyer gets a recess. Frankie tells the lawyer to ask Jimmy about Kelly Kinicki, hoping Jimmy will perjure himself and lose his immunity. Under cross, Jimmy is asked about Kinicki, everyone is puzzled by the questions, Jimmy then stuns the court again by admitting he killed Kelly, who was a State Police CI. Jackie hides a slight grin.

Later Ward is upset with Jimmy and wonders if Jackie knew.

Cathy Ryan goes home after the trial, Babsie Kinicki arrives noisily blaming Cathy, the women fight on,the sidewalk, Cathy gives better than she gets, putting down the other woman with a bloody face and an earful, as her three kids watch in silence.

Jackie again goes to see Jimmy thanking him for the amusement but still leaving a threat.

Cathy brings Kick to Court for Frankie's verdict. He is guilty on several counts and briefly slumps, then walks tall out of the courtroom. Outside, Kick says she saw Uncle Jimmy kill Kinicki. Cathy tries to explain the system how Jimmy gets off and Frankie goes to jail, but it's now just them having to survive. Jimmy is being driven away by a racist cop who is impressed how Jimmy conned the DA. Kick spits at the car as it goes past.

Outside Jackie's hotel Rosa arrives to tell him Jenny kicked her out, she wants his help. Jackie laughs at her and won't help, he jokingly tells her she can be a street hooker, leaving her forlorn and all alone.

Ward has a shower and takes a call, his campaign manager is stepping aside as Ward will be getting lot of bad press for the Ryan immunity. Ward is depressed, Siobhan tells him to pick himself up and work harder, she loves him.

Jackie is regaling the FBI about the Fall River arrests at Salvy Clasby's retirement pub night. He staggers out with Clasby after, both drunk. Clasby warns Rohr he was actually forced to retire due to problems with a CI. Jackie's car is trashed with Chinese script and lipstick markings. He calls someone, another CI, and gets the location of another car close by. They find the red sedan, Clasby gets the keys from the wheel well, starting the car it begins to smoke. They lift the hood, Rohr bursts out laughing at the failed car bomb. Clasby wanders away shaking his head, Jackie remains laughing.

Decourcy comes to Nathan Rey's office and offers to resign. As an alternative, Ward has some creative ideas to spin the Ryan cases, Rey tells him to knock off the BS and get back to work. He then goes to see Chris Caysen, suggesting they will work closely on drug and gun cases. Rachel pops by and has a private word with Ward. She gives him her file on Jackie, circumstantial evidence on his crimes and misdemeanors.

Ward goes to see Jackie at Jm Curley's Bar for a drink. Jackie has another anecdote about the former Boston Mayor. Decourcy teases Jackie by hinting Jimmy Ryan told him some things. He gives Hank Signa's flask with the Ali quote back to Jackie.

In the Roxbury Church Decourcy and Siobhan listen to an uplifting sermon about a City on a Hill

tags: ['anal rape', 'dead body in a car trunk', 'slasher', 'female vomiting', 'rape and revenge', 'rape', 'revenge', 'killing a rapist', 'rapist comeuppance', 'rapist', 'strangled to death', 'redneck', 'serial killer', "character repeats someone else's dialogue", 'wife murders her husband', 'woman murders a rapist', 'murderess', 'woman murders a man', 'abandoned car', 'tied up', 'sex scene', 'picking a lock', 'car accident', 'drill press', 'chains', 'death of husband', 'tied to a chair', 'abduction', 'workshop', 'woman tied up', 'man tied up', 'waterfall', 'fainting woman', 'shhh', 'saying shhh', 'mountain road', 'shushing someone', 'female pedal pumping', 'vomiting', 'death', 'murder', 'female protagonist', 'strangulation', 'shot in the head', 'strangled with a belt', 'abusive husband', 'man punches a woman', 'falling to death', 'thrown through a window', 'stabbed in the back']
synopsis_with_character_names:
While driving alone on a secluded mountain road Ellen (Bree Turner) loses control of her vehicle and collides with an abandoned car on the side of the road. When checking to see if the other driver is all right, she finds a trail of blood leading into the forest. Following it, she encounters a deformed, psychotic serial killer known as Moonface (John DeSantis), dragging the driver of the other vehicle. Narrowly escaping him, Ellen flees into the forest, with Moonface following her trail.

Through flashbacks spread throughout, Ellen is shown receiving training from her survivalist husband Bruce (Ethan Embry), training her with both weapons and guerrilla tactics. She attempts to use these skills several times, but despite her best efforts is still captured by the killer, taken to his workshop deep in the forest on a ridge overlooking a large waterfall.

After awakening in the basement, filled with the corpses of Moonface's previous victims, she encounters the delusional man Buddy (Angus Scrimm), apparently insane but seemingly unharmed by Moonface. He speaks cryptically of the killer's methods and intent. Shortly thereafter the killer comes downstairs, turning on a generator. Police sirens begin sounding as various lights around the room begin flashing. Lifting the other woman onto a large table, he uses a drill press to remove both of her eyes.

After Moonface leaves, Buddy talks Ellen into picking the lock on the chains binding her with a sharp object that had been jabbed into her shoulder. Buddy, who seemed to be tied up, suddenly stands up and began shouting that Ellen is free. Moonface returns, and Ellen attacks Moonface and Buddy with a piece of wood. She runs upstairs where she is again attacked, but this time manages to overpower Moonface and knock him out a window. Looking out, she sees him dangling by a blanket several meters below, hanging above the waterfall. She watches as the fabric rips, turning away as he finally falls. Finding a gun, belt and boots, she leaves.

Returning to her car, she opens her trunk to reveal the body of her dead husband Bruce. In another flashback it is revealed that Bruce had raped Ellen during a brutal fight, shortly after which she strangled him with his own belt. Taking his body to Moonface's workshop, she removes his eyes and strings him up in the front yard in the same manner as Moonface's other victims. Before leaving, she shoots and kills Buddy, mimicking Moonface's "shh" gesture. Ellen returns to her car where she starts it up and drives away.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Police officer Frank Spivey (Steven Weber) is eating lunch in his squad car when he happens upon a crazed man with a butcher knife forcing a young woman (Carrie Fleming) onto the ground. When Spivey intervenes, the man tells Spivey that he doesn't know what she is. Spivey shoots the man before he kills her. As he begins to console her he first notices that although she has an amazingly hot body, she has a horrifically disfigured face. Despite his initial revulsion she cuddles into his arms and he finds himself affectionately drawn to her. Spivey discovers that her name is Jenifer and that she is mute and most likely severely retarded.

That night he goes home and his wife Ruby (Brenda James) attempts to console him after learning of the shooting. As they begin to make love, he keeps picturing Jenifer and begins to anally rape his wife. She eventually forces him off her as he has lost himself in his fantasy of Jenifer.

The next day he visits Jenifer at the mental hospital to check on her. A male orderly comments that she has been freaking out the male staff. When he enters her room she is still in the shower and runs to embrace him completely nude. Spivey takes her to his home because he can find nowhere else that will take her. That night he dreams of a non-disfigured Jenifer seducing him. When he awakens she is standing in the room and his wife and his son Pete (Harris Allen) look at her in horror.

His wife issues an ultimatum that it will be her or Jenifer staying there so he again goes out to search for a place to take her. This time instead of looking, he is seduced by Jenifer in his car. When he brings her home he frightens away Spivey's wife and son, devours his cat, murders and eats his young neighbor Amy (Jasmine Chan). Spivey finally attempts to get a circus worker to kidnap her and put her in his freak show. When he arrives home, he finds Jenifer covered in blood and the circus worker dead in his refrigerator. Spivey takes Jenifer and flees to an abandoned cabin in the woods where she hopefully can't hurt anyone. Spivey gets a job at a small market and begins to slip out of Jenifer's spell.

One day however, Jenifer spies him with the attractive owner of the store and follows the shop owners son to a party. There she lures him into the woods and attacks him. Spivey discovers her devouring the kid and snaps. Grabbing her by the hair he forces her into the woods to kill her. Just as he's about to strike her down a deer hunter shoots and kills Spivey. Spivey's last words are ''Jenifer'' as the deer hunter moves to comfort her just as Spivey had done.

description: A hotshot White House speech writer deals with the publicity nightmare of his life when recently deceased soldiers return from beyond the grave.
tags: ['younger version of character', 'vietnam war veteran', 'afghanistan war veteran', "character repeats someone else's dialogue", 'marketing gimmick', 'wish', 'political campaign', 'return from the dead', 'eye gouging', 'world war two soldier', 'civil war soldier', 'accidental shooting', 'presidential campaign', 'politics talk show', 'vietnam soldier', 'world war one soldier', 'running for reelection', 'speech writer', 'white house', 'soldier', 'election', 'voting', 'political consultant', 'death', 'bare chested male bondage', 'neck breaking', 'full moon', 'hand from grave', 'voter fraud', 'shot to death', 'brother murders brother', 'death of brother', 'child uses a gun', 'gun in mouth', 'flashback', 'internment camp', 'head bashed in', 'undead', 'shot in the forehead', 'u.s. marine', 'political movement', 'severed leg', 'laboratory', 'severed arm', 'mother son relationship', 'cemetery', 'cell phone', 'shot in the arm', 'shot in the chest', 'back from the dead']
synopsis_with_character_names:
An unnamed US president (whose appearance is modeled after Bill Clinton and whose voice is modeled after George W. Bush) is running for reelection during a divisive war, and one of his speech writers, David Murch (Jon Tenney), goes on TV to speak with talk show host Marty Clark (Terry David Mulligan) and strident right-wing sexpot (and Ann Coulter-like) Jane Cleaver (Thea Gill). Another guest is Janet Hofstader (Beverly Breuer), the Cindy Sheehan-like mother of a dead soldier, who demands to know what her son died for. Murch gets a bit teary-eyed and explains that he lost his older brother Philip (Ryan McDonnell) in Vietnam.

"Believe me," he tells the grieving mom, "if I had one wish, I would wish for your son to come back, because I know he would tell us how important this struggle is." Cleaver is so impressed with Murch's handling of the situation that she takes him out for a drink later, picks his brain, and eventually seduces him. The Karl Rove-like Kurt Rand (Robert Picardo) interrupts their tryst, calling to let Murch know that the president plans to make his line part of his stump speech.

Soon, the soldiers killed in Iraq do start returning from the dead, and it doesn't go the way Murch predicted. They are not back to feast on the living, but unhappily for the president and his supporters, they just want a chance to vote in the upcoming election. "We'll vote for anyone who ends this war," one explains. The spin machine goes into overdrive, but the dead are determined to make their voice heard even going as far as one soldier killing Kurt Rand by acting out the zombie stereotype (gouging his eye and slamming his head into the table) when Rand tried to force him to sign an unwanted document by threatening the soldier's mother.

While voting results are being counted during the election, people within the current administration decide to skew the results so the current administration remains in power. After the election results are broadcast, more soldiers begin to return from the dead - but not just ones from Iraq: Soldiers begin to return from World War I and II, the Vietnam War, the Civil War, and etc. Eventually all of the people who died during war time to protect the United States of America have returned from the dead to seek their revenge.

The progress of the movie also reveals a shadowy mistake from Murch's past. He believed that his brother Philip was murdered in the Vietnam War only to discover that it was he who unintentionally killed him long ago with a gun in a game of "friend or foe". After Cleaver attacks the soldiers with her shotgun, Murch kills her and fails to kill himself. Murch is countered by a soldier that asks him to join them, saying "We're looking for a few good men." Philip is among those returning from the grave, saying he forgives Murch for killing him, and then snaps Murch's neck.

Now one of the zombies, Murch announces that he will show anyone who sends their brothers and sisters to die for a lie the true face of hell.
